intro: Phaca laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in coastal or inland regions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom during the warmer months. Phaca laxiflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
